caption:
Meet Danielle Mitchell, the visionary Founder and CEO of Black Women in Clinical Research (BWICR) (@bwicr20), a groundbreaking organization dedicated to increasing diversity, representation, and career opportunities in the clinical research industry!⁠
⁠
BWICR is more than a network — it’s a movement, a sisterhood, and a catalyst for change. Committed to bridging gaps in representation and creating career-changing opportunities, we are redefining the future of clinical research.⁠
⁠
BWICR is the largest Black organization in the clinical research industry, Black woman-led and breaking barriers to ensure that Black professionals thrive in clinical research and healthcare. ⁠
⁠
What They Do:⁠
- Advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion in clinical research⁠
- Connect Black professionals with top companies and job opportunities⁠
- Provide mentorship, career coaching, and professional development⁠
- Host impactful conferences, workshops, and networking events⁠
- BWICR is changing the game — one opportunity, one connection, and one success story at a time. Join them and be part of the legacy!⁠
⁠
Learn more and get involved: https://bwicr.com
